name: Condensate Safety Switch
description:
Scope of Work – Condensate Safety Switch Installation

Supply and install a new SS1 (primary pan float) or SS2 (secondary pan float) condensate safety switch to protect against water damage caused by condensate overflow.

Mount safety switch in appropriate location per manufacturer’s guidelines (SS1 on primary drain line, or SS2 on auxiliary drain pan).

Wire safety switch into low-voltage circuit to automatically shut down the air handler/furnace in the event of a clogged drain or overflow condition.

Test operation of the switch to ensure proper shut-off functionality.

Verify condensate drainage is clear and system is operating normally after installation.

Install refrigerant line set, control wiring, and condensate drain.

Test operation and provide basic use instructions.

Mitsubishi products include a 10-year warranty with the requirement that installation is completed by a licensed contractor and that the product is registered at https://metahvac.com/ within 90 days of installation.

1 year labor warranty included.

name: HVAC Removal and Replacement
description:
Scope of Work – Complete HVAC System Removal and Replacement (Fire Damage)
Project Description

This scope covers the removal and full replacement of the HVAC system due to fire damage. Work includes demolition and disposal of all affected HVAC components, followed by installation of new, code-compliant equipment and materials to restore full heating, cooling, and ventilation functionality to the property.

1. Demolition and Removal

Disconnect and safely remove all fire-damaged HVAC equipment, including:

Existing gas furnace and evaporator coil or air handler, and outdoor condenser unit.

All associated refrigerant lines, control wiring, drain lines, and electrical whips.

All supply and return air plenums, transition fittings, and dampers.

All flexible ductwork, metal trunk lines, and duct insulation throughout the structure.

All exhaust fans and ducting (bathroom, laundry, range hood vent, etc.) that were exposed to heat, smoke, or soot.

Dispose of all removed materials in accordance with local code and environmental regulations.

2. New Equipment Installation

Furnish and install new HVAC system of equal or greater capacity than existing (per Manual J load and approved specifications).

New outdoor condenser and matching indoor coil (heat pump or A/C configuration).

New furnace or air handler, properly sized and supported.

New line set, electrical whip, disconnect, and drain system.

New thermostat (programmable digital).

Install equipment to manufacturer specifications and local mechanical/electrical codes.

Pull vacuum, pressure test, and charge system to proper refrigerant levels per manufacturer data.

3. Ductwork and Ventilation

Design and install new duct system per current code and airflow requirements.

New insulated flexible duct runs for each supply branch.

New metal trunk lines, take-offs, and balancing dampers as needed.

Proper sealing and strapping per ACCA Manual D guidelines.

New return air drop and filter rack assembly.

Replace all removed exhaust fans (bath, kitchen, laundry) with code-compliant, energy-efficient models.

4. Start-Up, Testing, and Cleanup

Test all HVAC and exhaust systems for correct voltage, amperage, airflow, and refrigerant performance.

Verify thermostat operation and temperature split.

Label circuit breakers and equipment clearly.

Clean up all work areas and remove debris from site.

5. Warranty & Compliance

All workmanship guaranteed for 1 year from completion date.

All installed equipment covered by manufacturer’s standard parts warranty (typically 10 years upon homeowner registration).

System will meet or exceed all applicable local and national mechanical codes at time of installation.

name: Removal
description:
Temporary Removal of Vertical Air Handler or Furnace/Coil for Restoration Access
Recover and isolate refrigerant charge into existing outdoor condenser. Disconnect low-voltage and high-voltage wiring, condensate drain, copper refrigerant lines, and duct connections. Remove air handler from closet to allow access for restoration work and relocate unit to a protected area on-site.

name: 4 Ton Bosch 18.5 SEER2 Heat Pump
description:
Outdoor Unit: Bosch BOVA-60RTB-M20S (20 SEER inverter heat pump)

Indoor Unit: Bosch BIVA-48RCB-M20X  constant torque ECM air handler

Qualify for maximum energy rebates and save the most on energy costs with our highest efficiency offering: the Bosch Premium Premium 20 SEER System. The IDS Premium combines our top tier BOVA20 and BOVC20 outdoor units with our exceptional BVA20 two stage constant torque ECM style air handler.
The high-efficiency variable capacity inverter compressor can adjust to speeds ranging from 26% to 130% to perfectly cool and heat your home using minimal energy for maximum comfort. The BOVA20 and BOVC20 outdoor units can adjust to any speed between 36% and 130%. (in 1% increments). Additionally, the Bosch BVA20 air handler features a two-stage ECM motor. This capability allows the indoor blower to stage up and down to provide enhanced comfort, energy savings, and superior humidity control.

Removal & proper disposal of existing equipment

Installation of new indoor/outdoor units

Line set flushing of contaminations.

New electrical whip and disconnect

Pressure testing, evacuation, and factory-recommended startup procedure

System commissioning & performance verification

Jobsite cleanup and haul-away

10-Year Parts Warranty (with registration)

10-Year Compressor Warranty

1-Year Labor Warranty (included by Polar Air)

Optional: Extended Labor Warranty Available (up to 10 years)

name: York 4-5 Ton 18 SEER2 Heat Pump Split System
description:
Condenser HH860E2S11

Introducing the HH8, our latest addition to the LX Family of split system heat pumps. These cutting-edge heat pumps feature the next generation of low global warming potential refrigerant R-454B, making them environmentally friendly and energy efficient. With an impressive 18+ SEER2 rating, the HH8 is designed to deliver exceptional performance and savings. Featuring a state-of-the-art inverter driven compressor, the HH8 heat pumps offer precise temperature control to meet each customer's comfort needs. With the help of a conventional heat pump thermostat, the system automatically adjusts its capacity and airflow, ensuring optimal comfort while keeping energy bills in check. In addition, the HH8 incorporates advanced self-diagnostic features in both the main control and inverter control systems. This allows for quick and efficient troubleshooting, should the need for service arise. HH8 is the ultimate choice for superior comfort, energy savings, and system reliability.

Removal & proper disposal of existing equipment

Installation of new indoor/outdoor units

Line set flushing of contaminations.

New electrical whip and disconnect

Pressure testing, evacuation, and factory-recommended startup procedure

System commissioning & performance verification

Jobsite cleanup and haul-away

10-Year Parts Warranty (with homeowner registration)

10-Year Compressor Warranty

1-Year Labor Warranty (included by Polar Air)

name: 3 Ton M Series 14.3 SEER2 AC/Coil & 80%  Furnace
description: Includes removal of existing equipment and installation of a new AC Pro M Series 3-ton straight-cool condenser (14.3 SEER2) with matching evaporator coil and 80% AFUE low-NOx gas furnace. System uses eco-friendly R454B refrigerant; matching coil sized for 3-ton capacity. Includes supply plenum, gas flex connector and fittings, flue pipe and miscellaneous installation materials. System will be evacuated, pressure tested, charged to factory specification, and run-tested for proper airflow, temperature differential, superheat and subcool. Condenser/coil carry 10-year parts and compressor warranty (no registration required); furnace includes 10-year heat exchanger warranty and 1-year labor warranty.

name: AC Pro D-Series 18k Mini Split
description:
D-Series Mini-Split Installation – 18,000 BTU, 19 SEER2, Single Zone, Heat Pump

This proposal includes the complete installation of a high-efficiency AC Pro D-Series mini-split system (Model: AC Pro #: 83969    MFG #: MHPC-D-018BSC condenser with MWAL-D-018BSC indoor unit).

Scope of Work:
•Supply and install one (1) 12,000 BTU D-Series Mini-Split Heat Pump System, 19 SEER2 efficiency, R32 refrigerant, single-zone, wall-mounted indoor unit with optional built-in WiFi capability.
•Includes all necessary equipment, line set, drain line, electrical disconnect, mounting hardware, and materials for a complete installation.
•Remove and properly dispose of any existing equipment (if applicable).
•Test system for proper operation and performance.

Warranty:
•Manufacturer Warranty: 10-year parts and compressor (no registration required).
•Labor Warranty: 1-year coverage on installation workmanship.

Benefits:
•Energy-efficient design to help lower utility costs.
•Quiet rotary compressor and multi-speed operation for enhanced comfort.
•Environmentally friendly R32 refrigerant.

Included in Price:
•Equipment and labor
•Removal/disposal of old equipment
•Warranty coverage as outlined above

(does not include high voltage between breaker panel and outdoor unit)
